                                                                <div id="what" style="width: 1px; height: 100px; padding-top: 100px; margin-top: -100px;"></div>

                                <div class="red-circle mb-5">

Players get the feed in real-time on their device of choice and hear everything the croupier is saying. Most live online casino games come complete with a live chat feature. <h3 id="main-games">What games are available at live dealer casinos?</h3>
<p>Almost all the most popular casino games are available in a live game format. This includes common card games like Blackjack, Baccarat, Dragon Tiger, and Casino Hold’em, as well as table games like Roulette, Sic-Bo, and Craps. Some games, however, are outside the usual scope of casino games. For example, there are specialty titles that look like game shows or other uncategorized products.</p>
<h4>Blackjack</h4>
<p>Blackjack or 21 is the first casino game that moved to a live dealer platform online. You play against the dealer with other players at live tables and enjoy a nice gaming session with the possibility to chat with the dealer. Now that’s true-to-life online gaming!</p>
<p>Blackjack was, and still is, an extremely popular card game at land-based casinos, as it balances luck and skill-based elements nicely. Live dealer software providers have expanded on the subject of blackjack and set up different variations of the celebrated game. From Live Common Draw Blackjack to Live Playboy Blackjack, players have a wide selection of environments and side bets. You can also experience live blackjack in languages other than English at specific native live dealer tables. For example, Evolution is capable of offering live blackjack in various European languages such as Danish, Spanish, German, Norwegian, and Swedish. Other providers offer languages like Hindi.</p>
<h4>Roulette</h4>
<p>The goal of this casino game of chance is to guess the next winning number. You can place bets with other players with a simple click of the mouse. You can also choose the table that suits you the most. Pick between European, American, or French Roulette and cross your fingers.</p>
<p>Live roulette is a nice change from the light pace and the step-by-step gameplay typical of card games. Instead, it brings the suspense of having your entire bet depend on one little white ball. The betting possibilities are nearly endless, especially with modern innovative titles. The entire experience becomes even more challenging in the case of Live American Roulette which contains an additional zero. Furthermore, roulette can be played with native-speaking dealers, in languages such as French, Swedish, Turkish, Russian, Danish, Italian, and Hindi. These can be found at specific casinos supplied by companies like Playtech, Evolution, or Lucky Streak.</p>
<h4>Baccarat</h4>
<p>Baccarat was considered an aristocratic game for a long time. With the boom of online casinos, the game became available to regular players who have learned to appreciate its simplicity and huge payout potential. Live baccarat is another step towards making this simple-yet-effective card game even more popular. Thanks to live dealer providers like Vivo Gaming, Ezugi, and Playtech, you can enjoy Live Mini Baccarat, Live Knockout Baccarat, or Live Baccarat 7 Seat.</p>
<p>Bet on the banker, player, or tie and wait to see how lucky you are. Players new to the game are advised to avoid the tie bet because it has a higher house edge.</p>
<h4>Casino Hold’em</h4>

Instead, you can work on your decision making, finding a better casino, and better bankroll management.</p>
<p>If you are adventurous and want to experiment with playing exotic games, you should definitely give Sic Bo a try. You don’t have to let a computer simulate the dice roll. Titles like Live Sic-Bo by SA Gaming observe a dealer rolling real dice using a shaker at live casino tables.</p>
